channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Meadows, Giuliani, 11 'fake electors' from 2020 are among those indicted in Arizona
item.description: Arizona is now the fourth state where charges have been brought against individuals involved in so-called "fake elector" schemes that sought to undermine Joe Biden's victory over Donald Trump.
item.content:encoded:
Arizona is now the fourth state where charges have been brought against individuals involved in so-called "fake elector" schemes that sought to undermine Joe Biden's victory over Donald Trump.

(Image credit: Justin Sullivan)
item.dc:creator: Wayne Schutsky

item.title: Gateway Pundit files for bankruptcy after election conspiracy defamation lawsuits
item.description: The influential website faced multiple defamation suits over conspiracy theories about 2020 election fraud that it's accused of promoting.
item.content:encoded:
The influential website faced multiple defamation suits over conspiracy theories about 2020 election fraud that it's accused of promoting.

(Image credit: Evan Vucci)
item.dc:creator: Huo Jingnan

item.title: What consumers should know about the milk testing positive for bird flu
item.description: Federal officials and scientific experts say the virus detected in retail milk samples may be inactive and unable to cause an infection.
item.content:encoded:
Federal officials and scientific experts say the virus detected in retail milk samples may be inactive and unable to cause an infection.

(Image credit: Brendan Smialowski)
item.dc:creator: Joe Hernandez

item.title: Heated arguments at the Supreme Court in newest abortion case
item.description: At issue is a clash between federal and state law about how pregnant women must be treated in the emergency room.
item.content:encoded:
At issue is a clash between federal and state law about how pregnant women must be treated in the emergency room.

(Image credit: Catie Dull)
item.dc:creator: Nina Totenberg

item.title: Taylor Swift set a new record this week with, well, records. The vinyl kind.
item.description: Taylor Swift, whose latest album is now the first to surpass one billion Spotify streams in a single week, has smashed another record as well.
item.content:encoded:
Taylor Swift, whose latest album is now the first to surpass one billion Spotify streams in a single week, has smashed another record as well.

(Image credit: Terry Wyatt)
item.dc:creator: Neda Ulaby

item.title: In Florida, an exodus of people fleeing rising anti-immigrant sentiment
item.description: Nearly a year ago, Florida passed one of the toughest immigration laws in the country. It's caused an exodus in some communities. Those who stayed behind say it's made life terrifying.
item.content:encoded: Nearly a year ago, Florida passed one of the toughest immigration laws in the country. It's caused an exodus in some communities. Those who stayed behind say it's made life terrifying.
item.dc:creator: Jasmine Garsd

item.title: Shot by Israeli troops while getting aid, a boy in Gaza fights for his life
item.description: UNICEF says one child is injured or killed in Gaza every 10 minutes. This is the story of a 12-year-old boy shot by Israeli forces while he was trying to get food aid.
item.content:encoded: UNICEF says one child is injured or killed in Gaza every 10 minutes. This is the story of a 12-year-old boy shot by Israeli forces while he was trying to get food aid.
item.dc:creator: Rob Schmitz

item.title: The Story of One Child Living in Gaza
item.description:
As Israel's war against Hamas continues, children in Gaza are suffering. According to the United Nations, more than 25,000 children have been killed or injured since October. That's one child every ten minutes. We hear about one of those children, a twelve year-old boy injured in Gaza.

For more coverage of all sides of this conflict, go to npr.org/mideastupdates
item.content:encoded:
As Israel's war against Hamas continues, children in Gaza are suffering. According to the United Nations, more than 25,000 children have been killed or injured since October. That's one child every ten minutes. We hear about one of those children, a twelve year-old boy injured in Gaza.

For more coverage of all sides of this conflict, go to npr.org/mideastupdates
item.dc:creator: Rob Schmitz

item.title: Barbara Walters forged a path for women in journalism, but not without paying a price
item.description: Walters was the first woman to co-anchor a national news show on prime time television. "The path she cut is one that many of us have followed," says biographer Susan Page, author of The Rulebreaker.
item.content:encoded: Walters was the first woman to co-anchor a national news show on prime time television. "The path she cut is one that many of us have followed," says biographer Susan Page, author of The Rulebreaker.
item.dc:creator: Tonya Mosley

item.title: Biden signs $95 billion military aid package for Ukraine, Israel and Taiwan
item.description: Ukraine will get most of the weapons as it struggles to combat Russia's overwhelming firepower. The bill also includes more arms for Israel, and humanitarian help for Gaza.
item.content:encoded:
Ukraine will get most of the weapons as it struggles to combat Russia's overwhelming firepower. The bill also includes more arms for Israel, and humanitarian help for Gaza.

(Image credit: Evan Vucci)
item.dc:creator: Greg Myre
